info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 6:13PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Bertie and southwestern Chowan Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 613 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Cape Colony, or 11 miles north of Plymouth, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, pea size hail, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Bertie and southwestern Chowan Counties, including the following locations... Whites Crossroads, Merry Hill, Woodard, Edenhouse, Mount Gould, Macedonia, Hancock, Midway and Askewville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
